result.execSummary:
The defendant Savannah R. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including mandatory DNA Surcharge pursuant to Sec.973.046(1r), Wis. Stats.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------
Reimburse "buy money" to the Walworth County Drug Unit in the amount of $1,200.00.
------------------------------
**AMENDMENT 02-24-2015 - PURSUANT TO STIPULATION OF THE PARTIES AND BY ORDER OF THE COURT, the Defendant is to reimburse "buy money" in the amount of $1,100.00 to the Walworth County Drug Unit.
------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
------------------------------

Any other counseling as may be recommended by the Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended counseling.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with NO Work Release privileges to commence on or before August 1, 2015 @ 8:00 am.
The defendant is to complete forty (40) hours of community service work during her term of probation with NO BUYOUT.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CI1096 IF KNOWN TO HER. NO CONTACT WITH CO-DEFENDANT JOHN VAN VLEET.
